item.title: Olivia add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I couldn’t forgive him or like him, but I saw that what he had done was, to him, entirely justified. It was all very careless and confused. They were careless people, Tom and Daisy—they smashed up things and creatures and then retreated back into their money or their vast carelessness, or whatever it was that kept them together, and let other people clean up the mess they had made." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Olivia add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "She was like Marat only with nobody to kill her." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Olivia add a quote by Gustavo Perez Firmat
item.description: "The fact that I am writing to you in English already falsifies what I wanted to tell you. My subject: how to explain to you that I don't belong to English though I belong nowhere else" -- Gustavo Perez Firmat

item.title: Olivia add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Weeds are flowers, too, once you get to know them." -- A.A. Milne
